Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Cloud Expert Engineer who is ready to join our mission in creating a #CyberFit future!In this role you will be a main technical support expert in specific Company’s products or services. Your responsibility will be to resolve the customers’ technical incidents using your own expertise and extensive cooperation with the Company’s Engineering departments, as well as craft solutions, submit bug reports, coordinate complex tasks with other teams (Engineering, QA, DCO, Product Management), communicate with the customers to their complete satisfaction. Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up. WHAT YOU'LL DO Work on resolving various technical incidents for the Company’s customers involving various software, networking and hardware environments via email, phone and chat. Build and maintain strong relationships with customers able to thrive in the ever-changing work environment. Stay abreast of the latest changes, trends and technological advancements in the industry (Cloud, Storage, Virtualization, Business Applications, etc), while maintain deep knowledge of Company operations to support client requests effectively. Interact with various departments to analyze and resolve problems; Provide technical advice and mentoring to junior staff members and review technical results, evaluations and analyses. Develop documentation regarding installation, upgrades, support, and compatibility issues. Ensure that all relevant communication, documents, and files related to the case are accurately recorded in the support system WHAT YOU BRING Fluent French and English (both oral and written, Upper Intermediate as a minimum)Advanced technical knowledge in areas such as: Windows Server; Network troubleshooting (Wireshark, tcpdump, iperf); deploying and configuring services like DHCP, DNS, L2TP/IPSEC/Open VPN, HTTP servers Working knowledge of Linux/UNIX (application and configuration management; RHCSA as a baseline; CLI power user) Experience with Virtualization (know how to deploy and manage Virtual Machines on VMware ESXi / Microsoft Hyper-V clusters) Proficiency in Business applications (should be familiar with one or more of the following: MS Exchange, MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle DB, Citrix XenApp, NTP servers) Passion for troubleshooting Strong internal customer focus with desire to learn all aspects of the business High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy Outstanding organizational, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills Team-player and positive attitude, eager to do more and help out Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision *Please submit your resume and application in EnglishWHO WE AREAcronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, and top-tier professional sports teams. Acronis products are available through over 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries and 26 languages.Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.#LI-LD1

About Us
We empower people by upskilling and reskilling them on digital skills through Tech-enabled, affordable quality trainings. We provide trainings for the future of work on the most in-demand digital skills. We go fast and break things: So far, we have trained +50,000 students in 10 countries in Middle East and Africa.  What we're looking for We are on the lookout for a Product Manager who is passionate about creating meaningful educational experiences and is skilled in both the discovery and delivery aspects of product management. This role is not just about building features; it's about deeply understanding our business challenges, student needs, and market opportunities to develop solutions that significantly improve learning outcomes and operational efficiency. We are looking for a creative and passionate Product Marketing Associate (PMA) to support the Product team on the release and launch of new features and products. She/he will be responsible for developing marketing strategy for successful launches. A geek in the marketing world or a marketer-soul in the Tech space. 
Responsibilities

Discovery:

Lead user research and data analysis initiatives to uncover insights into student behaviors, needs, and challenges.
Work closely with business teams, designers, and students to identify and prioritize real problems that need solving.
Validate ideas through rapid prototyping, A/B testing, and early feedback loops.


Delivery:

Collaborate with engineering teams to define, design, and deliver solutions that address the identified business and user needs.
Manage the product development lifecycle, ensuring timely releases and high-quality outcomes.
Monitor product adoption and usage, iterating based on user feedback and performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.


Foster a culture of innovation, encouraging the team to think beyond traditional features and focus on impactful solutions.

Qualifications 
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Education, Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in product management, preferably in the edtech, online education, or digital learning sectors.
Proven ability to lead both discovery and delivery efforts in product development, demonstrating strong analytical, research, and project management skills.
Experience working directly with engineering teams and familiarity with agile development practices.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a track record of delivering solutions that address real business challenges.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to work effectively with teams across different functions and levels of the organization.


Experience with user research and usability testing methodologies.

Job Title:  Global Product Data Lead  Report to:    Global Manager of Merchandising & Product Data  Location:  Tunis  Overview of Role:  The role of the Global Product Data Lead is to handle Goldstar’s global needs to organise, maintain, and publish Goldstar product information and content using software including PIM, Oracle, Repoman, ATP, Goldstar Website Admin, and multiple Sourcing Platforms specific to the promotional products industry.  You will lead a team of multiple specialists, coordinators, and assistants, in working with a variety of programs to manage product, pricing, photos, images, and data in support of Goldstar’s product data needs, supporting both existing and new products, whilst maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.  Additionally, there will be projects to improve and develop our product line, and support GS team research and analysis needs with data gathering, spreadsheets, and presentations.  This role will also provide support language translations, management of English, French, German and Italian product data files and day-to-day support for Goldstar team needs.  You and your team will also collaborate with the Pricing, Competitive Analysis, and Compliance teams as needed.Performing the role in line with the Goldstar Values:Family - Treating our customers and our Goldstar team members like familySimplicity - Ensuring all of our solutions we supply for our customers are easy with no hassleDelighting our customers – We make sure every customer enjoys working with us by exceeding their expectations and providing the highest level of customer service and a quality productWork hard, play hard - Work hard and give our all and at the same time love and enjoy what we do  What you will do:  Work with team to assemble detailed product data and process improvements for Goldstar product data globally. Organise and make improvements to the New Product Introduction process globally. Build an expanded team to support increased needs and workload, and improving our level of service, for both EU and NA. Improve processes and gain efficiencies with aligning global workflows. Assure items are activated for GS in Oracle and work with Product Development and PDM teams for any corrections. Track inventories of active SKUs and communicate stock status issues globally. Direct editing and optimisation of new GS website platform & Sourcing Platforms with new/phaseout SKUs, process changes to keep information up to date. Support GS Sales and Customer Care teams by helping answer product questions. Maintain Product Image & Template library, working with NPI team, supervising workflow for Product Photographer and working with Graphic Artists as needed. Maintain Goldstar channel data and images in PIM to support PromoStandards data flows. Work with Samples Dept., Quality Control and Production teams as needed. Manage Product Databases, Masterfiles, Industry Platform data files and customer product databases – provide hands-on management of both customer & sourcing platform data files, ensuring they are up-to-date and uploaded to relevant websites and industry platforms. Sourcing platform optimisation – Undertake research to ensure Goldstar products are optimised on industry sourcing / search platforms globally.  Language translations – employ meticulous attention-to-detail in translating marketing materials from English into other languages, then proof reading and sign-off for printing. Provide analysis for category-level, product-level, and SKU-level sales data. Other duties and projects as required including but not limited to samples service support, industry research, and other support tasks.   What we need from you:Previous Experience and qualifications   A Bachelor’s Degree in is an advantage. 2+ years in a previous product, administrative, marketing or online/data management.  Key Skills and attributes   Languages – Written and oral fluency in English and French languages required (in addition; German or Italian are also desirable) Meticulous attention to detail is one of the most important skills for this role – you will be able to demonstrate how you let nothing slip through the cracks. Knowledge of Cimpress MCP, PIM, and similar systems, is a big advantage Computer literacy and proficiency in standard Microsoft Office applications and Excel in particular. Strong administrative abilities - excellent organisation and time management skills and a capacity to manage multiple projects. Problem solving skills - The ability to think on your feet, the ability to work hard under pressure, and great problem-solving skills are three essential attributes for this role. Asense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment.  What we will provide:  The opportunity for you to make a meaningful and serious contribution towards a very successful and rapidly growing business. A supportive environment with fantastic opportunities to grow and develop your career. A modern, fast paced, and exciting company culture.   Goldstar:  Goldstar, part of the global National Pen Group, is one of the industry’s fastest growing Trade Suppliers.  With a strong presence in both Europe and North America, Goldstar is becoming famous for offering a strong range of writing instruments, bags, and drinkware, combined with headache-free, all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers.   Goldstar’s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry, providing our distributors with amazing products and unparalleled service#LI-Hybrid   #LI-SK1

About the Role:We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated SuccessFactors Team Lead Consultant to join our team at Müller's Solutions. As a Team Lead Consultant, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing the implementation projects of the SuccessFactors suite for our clients. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and guide them in delivering successful and high-quality solutions that meet client requirements.Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage SuccessFactors implementation projects, ensuring project milestones are met and deliverables are of high quality. Provide guidance and mentorship to the project team, ensuring their training and development needs are met. Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into effective SuccessFactors solutions. Oversee the configuration, customization, and integration of SuccessFactors modules to align with client requirements. Work closely with project managers, functional consultants, and technical teams to ensure successful project delivery. Provide ongoing support and issue resolution for SuccessFactors implementations. Stay updated with the latest trends and developments in SuccessFactors and share knowledge with the team to drive continuous improvement.

job_title: Conseiller(e) de service à la clientèle - Langue Française
job_description: Titre: Conseiller(e) de service à la clientèle - Langue FrançaiseEmplacement: TunisAperçu du rôle :En tant qu'agent du service clientèle entrant de notre centre de contact, vous serez le premier point de contact de nos clients actuels et potentiels. Vous fournirez une assistance de première main en ce qui concerne les questions relatives aux ventes, aux comptes, aux problèmes et aux produits par téléphone et par e-mail.LES RESPONSABILITÉS PRIMAIRES:•Résoudre les requêtes et les problèmes des clients, négocier, de manière opportune par téléphone ou par e-mail.•Fournir des solutions appropriées et des alternatives dans les délais prévus et assurer le suivi pour garantir la résolution et la satisfaction du client.•Saisir et suivre les commandes, les retours, les livraisons et informer le client des mises à jour afin de garantir la satisfaction du client.•Traiter les commandes des clients et fournir des conseils d'expert sur les nombreux produits de l'entreprise.•Traiter les paiements, gérer les questions relatives aux factures et aux relevés et les transmettre, le cas échéant, à l'équipe compétente.•Maximiser les opportunités de vente en identifiant et en saisissant les offres commerciales•Développer et maintenir des relations solides avec nos clients•Travailler à la réalisation des objectifs•Maintenir une connaissance à jour de nos produits et de nos processus afin de s'assurer que les clients sont bien informés.•Adhérer et suivre les procédures, directives et politiques de communication de l'entreprise.•Projets et tâches ad hoc à la demande de la directionCONNAISSANCES/COMPÉTENCES/APTITUDES REQUISES:•Vous avez un excellent niveau en français•Un niveau acceptable en anglais•Une expérience préalable dans un poste de service à la clientèle est fortement souhaitable, mais un encadrement et un soutien complets et continus vous seront offerts.•Vous êtes orienté(e) vers le client et vous êtes capable de traiter avec nos clients de manière amicale et courtoise.•Vous êtes énergique, autonome et vous excellez dans les relations interpersonnelles, en mettant l'accent sur l'écoute et les questions.•Autonome et orienté(e) vers un objectif, toujours prêt(e) à se surpasser pour nos clients.•Vous êtes capable d'effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois et de gérer votre temps efficacement.•Forte volonté de fournir le plus haut niveau de service à la clientèle et volonté de réussir afin de dépasser les objectifs et de s'intégrer dans une organisation fondée sur le travail d'équipe.•Vous êtes capable de maintenir votre professionnalisme sous pression, d'analyser rapidement un problème et de le résoudre en suivant les procédures.•Vous aimez travailler en équipe, atteindre des objectifs et maintenir un niveau élevé de qualité du service à la clientèle.•Bonnes connaissances en MS office et d'autres systèmes•Excellentes aptitudes au téléphone et à l'envoi d'e-mails, ainsi que de solides compétences en matière de communication.Ce que nous offrons :• Un salaire attarctif• Premier jour d'initiation• Formation payée• Coaching et mentorat continus• Programme de développement de carrière• Environnement multiculturel• Programme de parrainage exceptionnel pour les employés afin que vous puissiez amener vos amis• Tickets restaurant• TransportÀ propos de National Pen :Les produits promotionnels personnalisés de Pens.com sont créés et inspirés par les petites entreprises. Avec 56 ans d'expérience et desservant 22 pays à travers le monde, Pens.com offre PLUS de valeur, d'économies et de temps à ses clients grâce à des conseils d'experts sur une large gamme de produits promotionnels personnalisés, notamment des instruments d'écriture, de la papeterie, des articles pour boissons, des sacs, des cadeaux et des salons professionnels. accessoires. Pens.com opère via un réseau de plus de 10 installations en Amérique du Nord, en Europe, en Afrique et en Asie.Pour en savoir plus, visitez : www.PENS.comPens.com est une marque National Pen et Cimpress (Nasdaq : CMPR).#LI-Onsite    #LI-NN1

Manage Product Databases, Industry Platform data files and customer product databases – provide hands-on management of both customer & sourcing platform data files, ensuring they are up-to-date and uploaded to relevant websites and industry platforms. Work with Samples Dept., Quality Control and Production teams as needed Help maintain a library of GS Compliance documentation Assure items are activated for GS in Oracle and work with NPI team for any corrections Track inventories of active SKUs and communicate stock status issues Other duties and projects as required including but not limited to samples service support, Industry Market research, and other support tasks    What we need from you:Previous Experience and qualifications   A Bachelor’s Degree in is an advantage 2+ years in a previous product, administrative, marketing or online/data management  Key Skills and attributes   Languages – Written and oral fluency in English and French languages required (in addition; German language is strongly preferred) Meticulous attention to detail is one of the most important skills for this role – you will be able to demonstrate how you let nothing slip through the cracks Knowledge of Cimpress MCP, PIM, and similar systems, is a big advantage Computer literacy and proficiency in standard Microsoft Office applications and Excel in particular, database experience is a plus Strong administrative abilities - excellent organisation and time management skills and a capacity to manage multiple projects  Problem solving skills - The ability to think on your feet, the ability to work hard under pressure, and great problem-solving skills are three essential attributes for this role Asense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment  What we will provide:  The opportunity for you to make a meaningful and serious contribution towards a very successful and rapidly growing business. A supportive environment with fantastic opportunities to grow and develop your career. A modern, fast paced, and exciting company culture.   Goldstar:  Goldstar, part of the global National Pen Group, is one of the industry’s fastest growing Trade Suppliers.  With a strong presence in both Europe and North America, Goldstar is becoming famous for offering a strong range of writing instruments, bags, and drinkware, combined with headache-free, all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers.   Goldstar’s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry, providing our distributors with amazing products and unparalleled service.

About us:
At Cognira, we strongly believe that people are the biggest asset of our company. Our hand-picked team consists of passionate, collaborative, and forward-thinking individuals from all over the globe. We are passionate about making science easy and accessible to retailers, helping them get more value from people, data, and systems. We bring together expertise in retail, science, and scalable technologies to automate and enhance the quality of decision-making through software and consulting services. For the last three years in a row, Cognira has been recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America. We are proud to have a growing team of domain experts and data scientists, as well as a culture that fosters strong and long-lasting relationships with our clients.  Our values: 
Stand up for what’s right
Customers are always first
Think like an Entrepreneur. Act like a CEO.
Learn, Unlearn, Relearn
No brilliant jerks allowed
All work and no play is no fun at all
 Are you ready to grow with us? To find out more about Cognira, please visit our website at www.cognira.com
About this role:
The Customer Support Associate will be responsible for engaging with our customers through the help desk portal to answer and/or route all questions into the organization for timely resolution. This role will also be responsible for supporting customers during regular updates and system changes; triaging and routing issues through the appropriate Tiers of support; and regularly contributing to internal and client knowledge bases. The position will require learning about Cognira’s offerings from a functional perspective and using that knowledge to answer day-by-day usage questions and coordinating with our team of technical experts.  Important: Please submit your resume in English only. What you will do:

Provide first-line response to customer questions during working hours
Respond with efficiency and tact; speed and courtesy to start, expertise comes over time
Become an expert in our software offerings and workflows
Participate in support rotations for client issues during business hours
For rare high-severity issues, some communication may be required outside of core business hours; this will be as needed and not a regular off-hours rotation
Coordinate work efforts across internal teams; effectively communicating with the client and escalating as needed to  manage each request to completion
Support clients during scheduled and ad hoc releases of new functionality and system maintenance
Assist with maintaining client-specific resources; assist with maintaining department confluence and training materials

What you bring to the table:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Empathetic approach to customer support
Excellent follow-up and meticulous organizational skills
Intrinsically motivated beyond delegated work
Thrive in a collaborative, feedback-driven environment
Ability to problem solve and develop creative solutions
Comfortable with technology-centered, fast-paced environments

Even better if you have:

2 years of customer service or case support experience
Retail experience
Understanding of agile methodology and Atlassian tool suite
High level of proficiency with Jira tools
Experience managing multiple clients with minimal supervision
 Important: Please submit your resume in English only. What we offer:

In addition to joining us on our journey to build state-of-the-art, AI-enabled software, you’ll also get a ton of perks!
Casual dress code, social events, and after-work activities. 
Flexible, diverse work environment. 
Respectful, innovative team.  
You get a competitive salary and a progressive bonus while getting a startup experience at a company with an awesome culture. 
Medical insurance for you & your family (spouse & children)
22 days of PTO in addition to national holidays.
Annual Wellness budget
Laptop & all necessary IT kit for work
Referral Program

Answer, record, and process all guest calls, messages, requests, questions, or concerns. Coordinate with Housekeeping to track readiness of rooms for check-in. Communicate parking procedures to guests/visitors and dispatch bell staff or valet staff as needed. Supply guests with directions and information regarding property and local areas of interest. Run daily reports (number of arrivals, departures), identify any special requests, and check reports for accuracy. Complete designated cashier and closing reports in the computer system. Cash guests' personal checks and traveler's checks. Count bank at the beginning and end of shift. Balance and drop receipts according to Accounting specifications. Follow all company safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent. Related Work Experience: No related work experience. Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience. License or Certification: None Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law. Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of “Wonderful Hospitality. Always.” by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name that’s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you. JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.
